data.question: What are the three cadmium selenide quantum dots synthesized in the study?
What method was used to determine the structures of the quantum dots?
data.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction and atomic pair distribution function analysis

data.question: What is the effect of increasing QD size on the full width at half-maximum (fwhm) of the lowest energy electronic transition?
data.answer: The fwhm decreases from 207 to 145 meV and then to 115 meV with increasing QD size

data.question: Is the photoluminescence of the synthesized quantum dots size-dependent?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the role of (TMS)2Se in the synthesis of quantum dots?
data.answer: It acts as a highly reactive selenium precursor that converts quantitatively into cadmium selenide

data.question: Can the synthesized quantum dots be separated by selective precipitation?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the significance of the reported atomic structures of the quantum dots?
data.answer: They bring us closer to an atomically resolved understanding of the chemistry and physics of quantum-confined semiconductors

data.question: Do the quantum dots exhibit a dynamic equilibrium with a coordinatively unsaturated species preceding growth?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the effect of curvature on the ligand packing density on the quantum dots?
data.answer: The effective curvature increases the volume available to the ligand shell, affecting the density of ligand atoms

data.question: Are the quantum dots synthesized in the study stable under exposure to air and various solvents?
data.answer: No

data.question: What is the relationship between the quantum dot size and the energy of the lowest energy electronic transition?
data.answer: The energy of the lowest energy electronic transition decreases as the size of the QD increases

data.question: Was the synthesis of quantum dots affected by the Cd:Se stoichiometry?
data.answer: Yes, varying the Cd:Se stoichiometry affected the synthesis outcome

data.question: What analytical technique was used to support the presence of benzoate and amine surface ligands on the quantum dots?
data.answer: Diffuse Reflectance Infrared Fourier Transform Spectroscopy (DRIFTS)

data.question: Did the quantum dots exhibit trap-luminescence?
data.answer: Yes, the photoluminescence spectra of all three QDs are broad with large Stokes shifts characteristic of trap-luminescence

data.question: What was the role of ligand coverage in the stability of the synthesized quantum dots?
data.answer: High ligand coverage contributes to the special stability of the quantum dots by minimizing unfilled coordination sites per surface atom

data.question: Was the atomic structure solution of the quantum dots achieved through ab initio determination from the PDF alone?
data.answer: No, ab initio determination of a structural solution from the PDF alone is a significant challenge

data.question: What was the effect of using different primary amines and carboxylates in the synthesis of CdSe(350 nm)?
data.answer: Little effect was observed in the UV-Vis profile, suggesting that the structure of the inorganic core is preserved

data.question: Did the synthesized quantum dots exhibit sensitivity to various conditions such as exposure to air and solvents?
data.answer: Yes, the quantum dots demonstrated sensitivity to various conditions

data.question: What was the role of curvature in the ligand packing density on the quantum dots?
data.answer: Curvature increases the volume available to the ligand shell, affecting the density of ligand atoms

data.question: Were the synthesized quantum dots characterized by laser desorption ionization mass spectrometry?
data.answer: Yes, but the LDI data did not reflect the true composition of the sample
